author: Kes53
title: Hidden away in convenient location
text:
We have just returned from 3 nights in Rome, staying at this little gem.
On arrival, there is little to tell you that the buildling is a hotel and, at first view, the area does not appear the best. However, as you explore the area, you realise that it is more 'shabby chic'. It is also ideally situated for many of the more ancient attractions. During our three days, we walked everywhere, from the Colosseum to the Villa Borghese and from the Vatican in the west to Termini in the east.
The welcome at the hotel and at breakfast was an ideal level of friendly, polite interest and attention.
Our room was warmly decorated and furnished with a very comfortable bed and some of the best hotel pillows I have ever encountered. The bathroom was all that we could need, including a jacuzzi bath, which was very welcome, especially on the feet, after a long day of walking.
For such a small hotel, breakfast was very good, with a selection of juices, good coffees, eggs as desired (perfectly cooked every day), cakes, breads and fresh fruits.
All of the team there deserve high praise. Thank you.
